page.title: 20CHIRNSIDE:PEARLIN JEAN
page.content: Sir Robert had spent most of his money on gambling and drinking and therefore needed his wife's money. Jeanne got word of what had happened. When the coach carrying Sir Robert and his new bride came up the driveway to Allanbank, Jeanne dashed out in front of the carriage with the baby in her arms, begging Sir Robert to come back to her. She was killed but the baby survived. From then on her ghost was said to haunt Allanbank. Sometimes her voice was to be heard; other people claim to have heard the rustle of her dress or even actually to have seen her apparition. Allanbank became an unhappy house and nothing ever went well for the Stuart family there again. Today, Allanbank lies in ruins, but the memory of Pearlin Jean lives on.
